meanings.definition: To bring upon oneself again (a liability or obligation)
meanings.sent1: After missing the payment deadline, he reincurred the late fee.
meanings.sent2: She knew that if she didn't pay on time, she would reincurred the debt.
meanings.sent3: John forgot to return the library book, so he reincurred the fine.
meanings.sent4: By neglecting his responsibilities, he reincurred the consequences.
meanings.sent5: The careless actions led him to reincurred the financial burden.

meanings.definition: To suffer (a penalty or consequence) again
meanings.sent1: Having ignored the warning, he reincurred the punishment.
meanings.sent2: She realized that by breaking the rule, she would reincurred the penalty.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat kept knocking over the vase, reincurred the scolding.
meanings.sent4: His reckless behavior caused him to reincurred the repercussions.
meanings.sent5: The repeated mistakes made him reincurred the pain of regret.

meanings.definition: To experience (a negative situation or outcome) again
meanings.sent1: After the flood, the town feared they would reincurred the disaster.
meanings.sent2: She hoped to avoid the past mistakes and not reincurred the tragedy.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy waiter managed to reincurred the chaos by dropping the tray.
meanings.sent4: The bad weather forecast indicated they might reincurred the storm.
meanings.sent5: The poor decisions led them to reincurred the same unfortunate events.
